Description: Body sherd of North Ionian Late Wild Goat Style pottery bowl; dull cream slip; interior glazed; from top: trace of tongue in added white with, to right, part of lotus flower in added red; wide red band; alternating red/black/white/black tongues; red band above traces of incision (tip of leaf?); exterior, from top: black band; goat running right (front half of one, looking back, and hind leg of goat); pendant rosettes, pinwheel rosette, dotted rosettes, and vertical strokes as filling ornament; wide black band with added red band lined in white; frieze of lotus flower and buds with traces of red.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.098)
CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (36, pl. 18, 18)
